    • Method Detail

      • quickSort

        public static void quickSort(int[] arr,
                             int begin,
                             int end)
        QuickSort algorithm takes an array, a start position and an end position. The array will be sorted in ascending order.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that is going to be sorted.
        begin - The first position in the array that will be sorted.
        end - The last position in the array that will be sorted.

      • partition

        public static int partition(int[] arr,
                            int begin,
                            int end)
        A helper method for the QuickSort algorithm that finds a point to partition.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that needs to have a partition position found.
        begin - The first start boundary for the array.
        end - The end boundary for the array.
        Returns:
        The position of the partition for QuickSort.

      • revQuickSort

        public static void revQuickSort(int[] arr,
                                int begin,
                                int end)
        Reverse QuickSort algorithm takes an array, a start position and an end position. The array will be sorted in descending order.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that is going to be sorted.
        begin - The first position in the array that will be sorted.
        end - The last position in the array that will be sorted.

      • revPartition

        public static int revPartition(int[] arr,
                               int begin,
                               int end)
        A helper method for the Reverse QuickSort algorithm that finds a point to partition.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that needs to have a partition position found.
        begin - The start boundary for the array.
        end - The end boundary for the array.
        Returns:
        The position of the partition for the Reverse QuickSort.

      • rndQs

        public static void rndQs(int[] arr,
                         int begin,
                         int end)
        Random QuickSort algorithm takes an array, a start position and an end position. The array will be sorted in descending order. The pivot element will be randomly chosen
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that is going to be sorted.
        begin - The first position in the array that will be sorted.
        end - The last position in the array that will be sorted.

      • random

        public static void random(int[] arr,
                          int low,
                          int high)
        Helper method for the random partition method, it will find a random pivot between the high and low values.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that will have its values taken from.
        low - The lower bound of the array and the lower bound of the random pivot.
        high - The upper bound of the array and the upper bound of the random pivot.

      • rndPartition

        public static int rndPartition(int[] arr,
                               int low,
                               int high)
        A helper method for the Random QuickSort algorithm that finds a point to partition.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array that needs to have a partition position found.
        low - The lower boundary for the array.
        high - The upper boundary for the array.
        Returns:
        The position of the partition for the Reverse QuickSort.

      • getComp

        public static int getComp()
        Getter for the number of QuickSort comparisons
        Returns:
        The number of comparisons of QuickSort

        Getter for the number of QuickSort switches.
